Oh yay.  Found a full can of dark oak stain that was no longer full.  It rusted through and leaked across three shelves in the garage.

Probably panicking.

I think I'm done buying books from Wizards of the Coast.  They can take their OGL 1.1 and shove it.

People in Florida are so funny.  It dips below 70F and suddenly there are people everywhere in parkas and Uggs boots.

Don't waste my time or yours.

What are the chances she'll let me hide a Tarrasque on a rampage in her n-scale Christmas village and train set this year?

Sooooo many variables.

@NoUselessTech Which is a whole 'nother can of worms (SMBs).  I did specify enterprises, but SMBs need to include "We close shop" in the potential outcomes.

I really like the 'moving meditation' as a way to get centered.
The instructor calls the hand position 'carry the ball' and the body position a shoulder strike, but it's hard not to yell, "Kamehameha!" sometimes.

Fix your algorithm and stop suggesting books I've read, already own, or have returned.

My wife and I have talked about words we can intuit the meaning of from our reading, but have never heard used in a conversation, so we mispronounce them.  It's usually the French words that have been Americanized that trip us up.

After hearing it used several times in the Sandman series, I had to look up the meaning of 'sobriquet'. 
I knew the general meaning from context in the show, but I'd never actually looked up the meaning before.

Sobriquet:  A nickname or a pet name.

My back:  You sure can, but only once.  Then you won't be carrying anything for a while.

I love writing that conveys a strong mental image with few words.

'the ravaged corpse of breakfast' 

In just a few words, I see a table covered in used dishes, empty plates, and all detritus left behind by a hearty meal.

I have things I could be doing today, reading reports, writing up reviews, etc.

But a sleepless night means I'm almost in the same mental state I'd be in if I'd actually attended Summer Camp last week.
